intro: Pholidia dichroantha, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its leaves are simple and opposite, with a slightly hairy texture. Pholidia dichroantha is often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides due to its adaptability to various soil types.
